document.heading: Energy Efficiency Financing Debt Cap Emergency Amendment Act of 2025
To amend, on an emergency basis, the Energy Efficiency Financing Act of 2010 to remove the limitation on the principal amount of bonds that the District may issue.
document.text: BE IT ENACTED BY THE COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, That this act may be cited as the "Energy Efficiency Financing Debt Cap Emergency Amendment Act of 2025".

section.text: Section 202(a) of the Energy Efficiency Financing Act of 2010, effective May 27, 2010 (D.C. Law 18-183; D.C. Official Code ยง 8-1778.22(a)), is amended by striking the phrase "of bonds in an aggregate principal amount not to exceed $250 million" and inserting the phrase "of bonds" in its place.

section.heading: Fiscal impact statement.
section.text: The Council adopts the fiscal impact statement of the Budget Director as the fiscal impact statement required by section 4a of the General Legislative Procedures Act of 1975, approved October 16, 2006 (120 Stat. 2038; D.C. Official Code ยง1-301.47a).

section.heading: Effective date.
section.text: This act shall take effect following approval by the Mayor (or in the event of veto by the Mayor, action by the Council to override the veto), and shall remain in effect for no longer than 90 days, as provided for emergency acts of the Council of the District of Columbia in section 412(a) of the District of Columbia Home Rule Act, approved December 24, 1973 (87 Stat. 788; D.C. Official Code ยง 1-204.12(a)).
